Body.title: Body
Body.value: In this assessment, weâ€™ll ask about your current data capabilities across six categories. At the end you will receive a high-level overview of your results with the option to see them in even more detail.

BeginText.title: BeginText
BeginText.value: To begin, please tell us about your company.

ToolTipText.title: ToolTipText
ToolTipText.value: Storage scalability, failover and recovery, performance, security, updates, operational analytics, in-memory OLTP and analytics capabilities, and query optimization.

Question.title: Question
Question.value: Do you use public cloud computing providers, such as Amazon Web Services (AWS) or Microsoft Azure?

Text.title: Text
Text.value: Storage scalability, failover and recovery, performance, security, updates, operational analytics, in-memory OLTP and analytics capabilities, and query optimization.

QuestionText.title: QuestionText
QuestionText.value: Is the uptime availability of your OLTP databases five nines or better (meaning 99.999% or about 5 minutes of downtime per year for 24/7 availability)?

QuestionText.title: QuestionText
QuestionText.value: Can you scale up your mission-critical OLTP databases using parallel processing?

QuestionText.title: QuestionText
QuestionText.value: Can you elastically scale out your OLTP databases to manage changes in the load of your applications (such as adding or removing servers without service interruption)?

QuestionText.title: QuestionText
QuestionText.value: Have you performance tuned your key mission-critical OLTP databases (for example: adding solid state drives or flash-based storage)?

QuestionText.title: QuestionText
QuestionText.value: Are you using in-memory technologies in your OLTP databases to get faster performance for your mission-critical applications?

QuestionText.title: QuestionText
QuestionText.value: Do you have the ability to always encrypt data at rest and data in motion (meaning your data is encrypted at all times, from database to application)?

QuestionText.title: QuestionText
QuestionText.value: Do you use the public cloud for data backup, recovery, and archiving?

QuestionText.title: QuestionText
QuestionText.value: Do you use public cloud databases or management tools for your customer-facing applications?

Text.title: Text
Text.value: Data storage, refresh frequency, storage span, ability to perform analytics and modeling, scalability for different types of workloads, and optimization through parallel processing.

QuestionText.title: QuestionText
QuestionText.value: Do you aggregate data from different applications and departments across your company in a centralized repository? In other words, do you have an enterprise data warehouse?

ToolTipText.title: ToolTipText
ToolTipText.value: We define an enterprise data warehouse as a single data repository that aggregates data across multiple systems and business functions across the company

QuestionText.title: QuestionText
QuestionText.value: Have you eliminated the majority of your data marts within individual departments or functions to focus on a centralized data warehouse?

QuestionText.title: QuestionText
QuestionText.value: Does your data warehouse contain all of the data elements you need for business intelligence reporting or analytics?

QuestionText.title: QuestionText
QuestionText.value: Is your data warehouse scalable enough to support all the data you're loading and all of the users accessing it without experiencing performance degradation?

QuestionText.title: QuestionText
QuestionText.value: Is the majority of information in your data warehouse refreshed daily or more often?

QuestionText.title: QuestionText
QuestionText.value: Do you use the public cloud for your enterprise data warehouse?

Text.title: Text
Text.value: Storage of unstructured data and ability to transform the same into structured data to perform analytics.

QuestionText.title: QuestionText
QuestionText.value: Is any of the data that your company stores unstructured?

ToolTipText.title: ToolTipText
ToolTipText.value: Unstructured data does not have a predefined data model. Examples include raw text, server logs, XML files, location data, and sensor readings.

QuestionText.title: QuestionText
QuestionText.value: Do you collect and store unstructured data (such as images, raw text, log files, and geospatial information) in a central repository within your organization (such as a file server, document management system, blob storage, or data lake)?

QuestionText.title: QuestionText
QuestionText.value: Do you transform unstructured data into structured data for future analysis (for example: clickstream activity analysis, server logs, or sensor data logs)?

QuestionText.title: QuestionText
QuestionText.value: Are you using big data technologies such as Hadoop or Spark as a central repository to store your data (in other words, do you have an enterprise data lake)?

QuestionText.title: QuestionText
QuestionText.value: Do you use the public cloud for distributed big data technologies such as Hadoop or a data lake on the cloud?

Text.title: Text
Text.value: Enterprise-wide reporting and analytics that deliver business insights.

QuestionText.title: QuestionText
QuestionText.value: Does your company have policies or guidelines related to how data can be used and analyzed?

QuestionText.title: QuestionText
QuestionText.value: Can business users easily access key reports, KPIs, and dashboards on mobile devices?

QuestionText.title: QuestionText
QuestionText.value: Can business users create new interactive visualizations of data on their own to develop potential insights?

QuestionText.title: QuestionText
QuestionText.value: Can business users receive real-time or near real-time alerts or notifications based on the conditions they've defined?

QuestionText.title: QuestionText
QuestionText.value: Can you extract data from different cloud-based or hosted applications (such as Salesforce, Google Analytics, or Workday) and combine it in an automated way with on-premises data to create BI reports?

QuestionText.title: QuestionText
QuestionText.value: Have you deployed business intelligence tools on the cloud or as a software-as-a-service application?

Text.title: Text
Text.value: Predictive analysis and modeling, machine learning, statistical analysis, and root cause analysis thatâ€™s used to create â€œsmartâ€ apps and provide data-driven insights.

QuestionText.title: QuestionText
QuestionText.value: Do you programmatically run root cause analysis on data to identify root causes for customer churn, product issues, and other concerns?

QuestionText.title: QuestionText
QuestionText.value: Does your company develop predictive models to anticipate customer churn, equipment failures, or other potential issues before they occur?

QuestionText.title: QuestionText
QuestionText.value: Have you implemented predictive models in your key software systems?

QuestionText.title: QuestionText
QuestionText.value: Do your models prescribe one or more courses of action and show the likely outcome of each decision?

QuestionText.title: QuestionText
QuestionText.value: Do you use the public cloud for advanced analytics, machine learning, and data modeling purposes?

Text.title: Text
Text.value: Migration of various workloads (including app development, backup, and recovery) to the cloud and delivering services through the cloud.

QuestionText.title: QuestionText
QuestionText.value: Have you applied virtualization technologies to the majority of systems in your organization?

QuestionText.title: QuestionText
QuestionText.value: Do you use the public cloud for development and testing of new data solutions?

QuestionText.title: QuestionText
QuestionText.value: Do you use the public cloud for temporary compute-intensive tasks (such as spinning up additional virtual machine instances to complete a particular analysis)?

QuestionText.title: QuestionText
QuestionText.value: Have you used the public cloud to deploy applications that integrate with databases behind your firewall (meaning have you deployed a hybrid cloud)?
